pullRequest.body:
Show that the tensor product over the integers is a coproduct in the category of commutative rings. This is needed for constructing a `ChosenFiniteProducts` instance for the category of affine schemes. It would be nice to have the more general statement for commutative `R`-algebras, but it seems like mathlib does not define the category of commutative `R`-algebras yet.

---

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message

- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

### PR summary [82154395cb](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19976/commits/82154395cb1569afd4aa997510985501873d40bf)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coproductCocone`
`+ coproductCoconeIsColimit`
`+ coproductCocone_inl`
`+ coproductCocone_inr`
`+ coproductColimitCocone`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

As @erdOne suggested in #19977, I moved the content to the file `Constructions.lean`, which already contains similar constructions of colimits in `CommRingCat`. I also changed some names to better match the existing content.

:v: justus-springer can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Do you understand why this `erw` is needed? Is there a missing lemma?
Or maybe it goes away after merging master? Because there were refactors or concrete categories like `CommRingCat` in the past days.
No I don't know exactly why it's needed. I'll merge master and look at it again.
You're right, simp closes the goal now (it did not originally as far as I recall).

```suggestion
    · ext a
      simp [map_one, mul_one, ←hm (Discrete.mk WalkingPair.left)]
    · ext b
      simp [map_one, mul_one, ←hm (Discrete.mk WalkingPair.right)]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(Algebra/Category/Ring): Tensor product over Z is coproduct in `CommRingCat`
